docs.lead_paragraph: High bodily levels of the trace elements nickel and selenium may be associated with reduced risk for pancreatic cancer, and high levels of arsenic, cadmium and lead may increase the risk.

headline.seo: Trace Elements and Levels of Pancreatic Cancer Risk
headline.main: Patterns: Trace Elements and Pancreatic Cancer Risk
headline.print_headline: Patterns: Trace Elements and Pancreatic Cancer Risk

docs.abstract: Study published in journal Gut finds that high bodily levels of the trace elements nickel and selenium may be associated with reduced risk for pancreatic cancer and that high levels of arsenic, cadmium and lead may increase that risk; Nuria Malats of the Spanish National Cancer Research Center is study's lead author.
docs.snippet: High bodily levels of the trace elements nickel and selenium may be associated with reduced risk for pancreatic cancer, and high levels of arsenic, cadmium and lead may increase the risk.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a study of 30,000 men and women, those whose rates increased over a decade were almost twice as likely to die of heart disease.

headline.seo: Rise in Resting Heart Rate Linked to Coronary Artery Disease
headline.main: Risks: Resting Heart Rate as Simple Biomarker
headline.print_headline: Risks: Resting Heart Rate as Simple Biomarker

docs.abstract: Study co-authored by Ulrik Misloff and published in The Journal of the American Medical Association finds that a rise in resting heart rate over a decade may indicate an increased risk of death from coronary artery disease.
docs.snippet: In a study of 30,000 men and women, those whose rates increased over a decade were almost twice as likely to die of heart disease.

keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: “Confessions of a Surgeon,” by Dr. Paul A. Ruggieri, and “The Patient’s Checklist,” by Elizabeth Bailey, are guidebooks to clarify customs and keep you out of trouble when you receive care in a hospital.

headline.seo: Two Choices for the Best Read for a Hospital Stay
headline.main: Two Choices for Best Bedside Read in the Hospital
headline.print_headline: Two Choices for Best Bedside Read in the Hospital

docs.abstract: Dr Abigail Zuger reviews books Confessions of a Surgeon: The Good, the Bad and the Complicated...Life Behind the OR Doors by Paul A Ruggieri and The Patient's Checklist: 10 Simple Hospital Checklists to Keep You Safe, Sane and Organized by Elizabeth Bailey.
docs.snippet: “Confessions of a Surgeon,” by Dr. Paul A. Ruggieri, and “The Patient’s Checklist,” by Elizabeth Bailey, are guidebooks to clarify customs and keep you out of trouble when you receive care in a hospital.

docs.lead_paragraph: Eric Lander laid the groundwork for a joint venture between two fierce rivals: Harvard and M.I.T.

headline.seo: Broad Institute Collaboration Began With a Disastrous Lunch
headline.main: A Collaboration That Began With a Disastrous Lunch
headline.print_headline: A Collaboration That Began With a Disastrous Lunch

docs.abstract: Profile of Dr Eric Lander, founder of the Broad Institute at Harvard and MIT, which was largely financed by billionaire philanthropist Eli Broad; Lander had envisioned research institution that would combine MIT's excellence in research, science and technology with Harvard's medical prowess.
docs.snippet: Eric Lander laid the groundwork for a joint venture between two fierce rivals: Harvard and M.I.T.

docs.lead_paragraph: Urine has a uniquely valuable role in medicine: It holds clues not just to what people eat and drink, but also to how well their bodies are functioning.

headline.seo: A Valuable Medical Tell-All Can Be Found in Urine
headline.main: A Medical Tell-All Can Be Found in Urine
headline.print_headline: A Medical Tell-All Can Be Found in Urine

docs.abstract: Jane E Brody Personal Health column on the various medical uses of urine, which can give clues about dietary health and organ function.
docs.snippet: Urine has a uniquely valuable role in medicine: It holds clues not just to what people eat and drink, but also to how well their bodies are functioning.

docs.lead_paragraph: Certain disease-causing variant genes became more common in African-Americans after their ancestors reached American shores, scientists report.

headline.seo: Genome Research Points to Adaptation Among Early African-Americans
headline.main: Genome Study Points to Adaptation in Early African-Americans
headline.print_headline: Genome Study Points to Adaptation in Early African-Americans

docs.abstract: Study published in journal Genome Research finds that certain disease-causing variant genes became more common in African-Americans after their ancestors reached America, while others, such as the gene for sickle cell hemoglobin, have become less common; researchers, led by Li Jin of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, suggest certain genes may have proliferated because they conferred secondary, offsetting benefits.
docs.snippet: Certain disease-causing variant genes became more common in African-Americans after their ancestors reached American shores, scientists report.

docs.lead_paragraph: Eric Lander, the head of the Broad Institute, went from the most solitary of sciences (math) to forging collaborations on the leading edge of biology, a field he never formally studied.

headline.seo: Broad Institute Director Finds Power in Numbers

docs.abstract: Profile of Eric Lander, mathematician who went on to become a founding director of the interdisciplinary Broad Institute of Harvard and MIT, where he presides over a veritable empire of biological research.
docs.snippet: Eric Lander, the head of the Broad Institute, went from the most solitary of sciences (math) to forging collaborations on the leading edge of biology, a field he never formally studied.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hardy and reliable in the winter months, turnips are a logical foundation for comforting stews and gratins, but they’re also at home in egg or noodle dishes.

headline.seo: Turnips: Versatile and Nutritious in Any Season — Turnips: Versatile and Nutritious in Any Season
headline.main: Turnips: Versatile and Nutritious in Any Season

docs.snippet: Hardy and reliable in the winter months, turnips are a logical foundation for comforting stews and gratins, but they’re also at home in egg or noodle dishes.
